trans-unit.source: Represents the collection that contains the indexes to the selected items in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> stores the indexes to the selected items in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
The indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> are index positions within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores all items displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

The following table shows an example of how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores the items of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> and shows their selection states in an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
Index
Item
Selection state in the ListView
Item1
Unselected
Item2
Selected
Item3
Unselected
Item4
Selected
Item5
Selected

Based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> would appear.
Index
Index of selected item in the ListViewItemCollection
You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an index position from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is one of the indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.

Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref> class.
You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control that owns the collection.
Adds the item at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Items"></xref> array to the collection.
This method will return 0 if the handle has not been created for the owning <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.

(You can determine whether the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> has an associated handle by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsHandleCreated%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.) This method will return -1 if the handle has not been created for a virtual <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
The index of the item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Items"></xref> collection to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
The number of items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
The specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of items in the owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref>.
-or-

The owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is in virtual mode, and the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.VirtualListSize"></xref>.
Clears the items in the collection.
Use this method to clear all the selected items.
Determines whether the specified index is located in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an index position from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is one of the selected indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.

Once you know that an item is in the selected index collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.
The index to locate in the collection.

`true` if the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is an item in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.
You can use this method to combine the selected indexes from multiple collections into a single array.
An <xref href="System.Array"></xref> representing the array to copy the contents of the collection to.
The location within the destination array to copy the items from the collection to.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
This property enables you to determine the number of selected items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.MultiSelect%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is set to `false`, this property returns a value of either 0 or 1 depending on whether an item is selected.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the selected index collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the selected index collection.

Returns the index within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref> of the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control.

Once you know that an item is in the selected index collection (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method), you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.
The zero-based index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> to locate in the collection.

The zero-based index in the collection where the specified index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> is located within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>, or -1 if the index is not located in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
This property is always `true` for this collection.
The items in the collection can be modified only by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the index value at the specified index within the collection.
This indexer enables you to get a specific selected index from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.

The index stored in the collection is an index into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that represents a selected item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.
The index value from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> that is stored at the specified location.
index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Removes the item at the specified index in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Items"></xref> collection from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is in virtual mode and the handle for the owner <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> has not been created (you can check this using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsHandleCreated%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property), calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection.Remove%2A> method will have no effect on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>.
The index of the item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Items"></xref> collection to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
The specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of items in the owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref>.
-or-

The owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is in virtual mode, and the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.VirtualListSize"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
The object used to synchronize the collection.
Adds an item to the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> class directly.

To add the index of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
An object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
The location of the added item.
Always thrown.
Removes all items from the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> class directly.

To clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property to `false` for each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
Always thrown.
Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.
The index to locate in the collection.

`true` if the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is an item in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the index in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref> contains the indexes of selected items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control.
The zero-based index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> to locate in the collection.
Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> class directly.

To add the index of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted..
The object to be inserted into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
`true` in all cases.
Gets or sets an object in the collection.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The index value from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> that is stored at the specified location.
Removes the first occurrence of a specified item from the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
The object to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Removes an item from the collection at a specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Selected%2A> property.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
Always thrown.
